revised_title: A Curious Case of Conjoined Twins
tldr: A letter from John Torlese, Esq. describes the birth of a rare case of conjoined twins, with two heads, four arms, and two legs. The children were briefly alive and had distinct personalities, sleeping and crying independently. This unusual case attracted significant attention in the town. The mother and her other children were healthy and normal.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Medical History
